name: Hotel de Rome et St Pierre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for £53/night from hotels.com. I was looking for somewhere cheap and close to Saint Charles station to sleep only. The hotel is a ten min walk from the main train station just off the main La Canebiere street. The walk from the station was fine and well lit, as was the area where the hotel is located. I felt safe during the walk at 11.30pm. The hotel room was a little larger than average but the bathroom was a bit tired looking. The windows were open and there was a lot of noise from the street. When I shut the windows, I heard nearly nothing from the street as it had secondary glazing. The website states the rooms were renovated two years ago. I don't think this was the case as the decor looked quite old. However, this place was perfect for the night and in a good location and I would stay here again at the price I paid.
reviews.title: Fine For The Night
OK, but in Scary Part of Marseille
reviews.text: Easy walk from St. Charles train station in Marseille. It was in a bad part of Marseille. If you go to the hotel, STAY THERE. I was pick pocketed even being careful - stick your wallet IN your pants! The reception desk is one flight up, so don't take too much luggage! The staff was very nice. The room was small with two twin beds. There was a 13" TV, which was fine. The bathroom had a sink and a shower (that was small!) The toilet was in a separate closet, and there are plumbing issues at the hotel - you have to flush 5 or 6 times... The air conditioning was fine, but you'd better be tall to be able to turn it on! The view out the window was scary and looked into an alley. The hotel was noisy with doors slamming, people chattering, etc. I cannot recommed it because of the location.
I was there for my job, so I did not choose or pay directly my room.
reviews.title: more bads than goods

reviews.text: We spent one night at this hotel and definitely felt it was not a 3 star hotel . It was noisy due to paper thin walls, construction in the area outside of the hotel, and in less than a favorable part of town. We witnessed a fight in the street outside of our hotel that the police were called to handle. The hotel itself is old with old, musty furniture and lots of steps. We spent two and a half weeks in Europe in eight different hotels and this was the only bad experience we had. We would never stay there again and would definitely not recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Not a three star hotel by a long stretch....
Wouldn't go there again
reviews.text: Situated in a grimey area. Noisy as construction work going on in square. The area smells. I cannot see why it is 3 star rated. The lobby smells. Room functional. Breakfast was rubbish, for 9 euros. Much better to go to one of the caffs in the Vieux Port. I really like Marseilles, incidentally.

As stated in another user review, why this hotel is rated 3 stars is beyond us. It is in a sleazy part of town, and is noisy and second rate. It is not terribly close to the train station, it does not have an airport shuttle (as advertised on its web site), and it looks nothing like the photo of it that is online.
reviews.title: quite a disappointment
Would not recommend
reviews.text: Our plan was to spend one night in Marseille, return a rental car, and then go to the airport the next morning. Trying to find the hotel by car was a nightmare, as it is on an alley that looks as though it is pedestrian only, and there was nowhere to unload. We then returned the car to the rental agency at the train station, and walked back to the hotel. The walk was okay, but would absolutely have been too far with luggage. We then spend a sleepless night in this hotel as music from a disco across the way blared on until 2am. The room itself was okay, but nothing to write home about (reminded me of a Motel 6). And in the morning, we were informed that the "airport shuttle" is available at the train station (which would have meant dragging our luggage there). A taxi ride from the hotel to the airport was 45 euros!

reviews.title: Marseille, the way it is (for me)
reviews.text: On the upside, the staff was very friendly.
